title: Super Stickman Golf
text:
Super Stickman Golf is a <a href="golf">golf</a> <a href="video%20game">video game</a> developed by Canadian studio Noodlecake Games and released for <a href="iOS">iOS</a> and <a href="Android%20%28operating%20system%29">Android</a> devices on June 7, 2011. A sequel entitled Super Stickman Golf 2 was later released on March 14, 2013. Following the success of the first two iterations, Noodlecake Games released Super Stickman Golf 3 on July 6, 2016. This new version included a new game mechanic where players could put spin on their shot, as well as new power-ups and hats. but the <a href="Android%20%28operating%20system%29">Android</a> version of Super Stickman Golf 3 was removed of <a href="Google%20Play">Google Play</a> on 2021.
Critical reception.
Each of the "Super Stickman Golf" apps has received critical acclaim. "<a href="The%20A.V.%20Club">The A.V. Club</a>" gave "Super Stickman Golf" an A, describing it as "A no-nonsense hybrid of a platformer and a golf sim that manages to be the rare iOS game with staying power". Level7.nu rated the game 9/10, writing "Lots of tracks, great controls, fun superpowers, engaging leaderboards and great multiplayer. This is one of my favorite iPhone games of all time." "<a href="Eurogamer">Eurogamer</a>" gave the game 8 out of 10, saying "So even if golf brings out your inner chainsaw-wielding Alf Garnett, face your demons with this playful physics-based catharsis. All yours for 59p."
"Super Stickman Golf 2" has a <a href="Metacritic">Metacritic</a> score of 87 out of 100 based on 16 critics, indicating "generally favorable reviews".
"Super Stickman Golf 3" received the Metacritic award for iOS Game of the Year in 2016, having a score of 95 out of 100 based on seven critics, indicating "universal acclaim".
